properties.EventComments: Due to adverse weather forecast, SH2 between Wairoa and Gisborne will be closed overnight on Sunday 15th February between 8pm and 7am on Monday 16th February. Avoid the area or delay your journey if possible.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 2 Wairoa to Gisborne

properties.LocationArea: SH 30A Fenton Street to Te Ngae Road
properties.EventComments: Asphalt resurfacing will take place from Tue, 27 Jan till mid-Feb between 8 pm and 5 am, Sun to Thu. An eastbound closure will be in place each night. All four lanes will be open to traffic during the day. Please drive with care as the road surface will be uneven and have steep ramps with speed restrictions in place. Access to the footpath will be maintained for pedestrians and cyclists.
properties.AlternativeRoute:
Light vehicles SH30 Te Ngae Road, Sala Street (SH30), right to Fenton Street, to Amohau Street (SH30A), and vice versa.
HPMV use SH30 Te Ngae Road, left for Sala Street (SH30), left to Hemo Road, right to State Highway 5 to SH30A Pukuatua Street, and vice versa.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 30A Fenton Street to Te Ngae Road

properties.LocationArea: SH 5 Gilltrap Street to Pukuatau Street
properties.EventComments: Ashphalt resurfacing is taking place from Sun, 15 Feb to Thur, 19 Feb, between 8pm and 6am each night. A southbound road closure will be in place with the northbound lane used to maintain traffic in both directions. Temporary traffic management with speed restrictions will remain in place until the road has been line-marked. Please drive with care and follow the crew instructions on site.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 5 Gilltrap Street to Pukuatau Street

properties.EventComments: Due to resurfacing work in this area during the night. Stop/Go traffic management and speed restrictions will be in place. Expect delays
properties.Name: Road Work: SH 1 Kauri

properties.EventComments: Due to underslip repair works, this section of road will be closed in both directions on Sunday to Friday nights between 8pm and 6am from Monday 1st December to Saturday 28th February (Excluding Thursday 18th December to Sunday 4th January). Plan your journey accordingly, avoiding travel during these times.
properties.AlternativeRoute: No detour available. Please note access is permitted to Rosie Bay Campsite during these works.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 38 Tuai to Lake Waikaremoana

properties.EventComments: Due to bridge maintenance works, this bridge will be closed on Sunday to Thursday nights between 8pm and 6am from Sunday 18th January to Friday 27th March (Excluding Public Holiday weekends). Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for travel if travelling at night.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Detour via Kane Road and Camp Hill Road. Please note this detour will add approximately 30 minutes to your journey time and is not suitable for  HPMV or 50MAX vehicles. HPMV or 50MAX vehicles, detour via Kane Road, Cemetery road, Domain Road and Capell Avenue.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 8A Luggate (Red Bridge)

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 Taradale, between the intersections of Meeanee Road and Taradale Road
properties.EventComments: Due to various works, this section of road will be closed in both directions on Sunday to Thursday nights between 8pm and 5am from Tuesday 3rd February for approximately 4 weeks. Plan your journey accordingly allowing extra time for travel.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Detour via Meeanee Road, Lee Road, Gloucester Street and Taradale Road.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 2 Taradale, between the intersections of Meeanee Road and Taradale Road

properties.LocationArea: SH 3 Inglewood, between Norfolk Road and Durham Road intersections.
properties.EventComments: Due to a fallen tree, this section of State HIghway 3 is under temporary stop/go traffic management with a 30km/h speed restriction in place. Road users are advised to stop on request and take extra care along this route.
properties.Name: Road Hazard: SH 3 Inglewood, between Norfolk Road and Durham Road intersections.

properties.EventComments: This closure is dependent on various factors, including weather, and may be postponed or cancelled at late notice. Road users should plan accordingly and allow extra time for the detour.

properties.LocationArea: SH 51 Whakatu, between Railway Road and Station Road.
properties.EventComments: Due to a tree blocking both lanes, SH51 is closed between Railway Road and Station Road intersections.  Please follow the detour.
properties.AlternativeRoute: For northbound traffic turn left onto Station Road then right onto Railway Road, and reverse for southbound traffic.  This route is suitable for all vehicles.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 51 Whakatu, between Railway Road and Station Road.

properties.EventComments:
Due to poor weather the works are postponed. Works are now expected to occur from 16 February to 9 March.

SH1 will be closed between Rangipo and Waiouru from 7pm to 6am on Sunday to Thursday nights from Sunday 15 Feb to Monday 9 March due to road rebuilding work. Speed restrictions will be in place during the day. Expect delays.
properties.AlternativeRoute: detour via SH41, SH47, SH4, SH49 and back to SH1
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 01 Rangipo to Waiouru

properties.EventComments:
SH2 Waioweka Gorge is closed to the public between Matawai and Opotiki following slips. Essential travel is available by piloted convoy three times a day (in each direction). Convoys are cancelled on Sunday 15 Feb and the morning of Monday 16 Feb. Afternoon convoys on 16 Feb are to be confirmed.

Convoy schedule: Gisborne-bound departs Goldsmith Reserve at 7am, 11am, 5pm; Opotiki-bound departs Te Wera Road Intersection at 9am, 1pm, 7pm. 

For non-essential travel, use an alternative route.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Southbound: Head West on SH2 toward Whakatane, then turn right to stay on SH2, then turn left on to SH30, then turn left on to SH5, then turn left on to Settlers Rd, then continue straight on to Broadlands Rd, then use the on-ramp to join SH1 headed south, then turn left on to SH5, then turn left on to Low Level Rd, then turn right, then turn left on to SH5, then turn on to SH2. Northbound follow in reverse.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 2 Opotiki to Matawai (Waioweka Gorge)

properties.LocationArea: SH 2 SH2 Kaitoke to Featherston (Remutaka Hill)
properties.EventComments: Due to various works on Remutaka Hill, the road is scheduled to close in both directions on Monday 16th February to Thursday 19th February nights between 9pm and 4am. Plan your journey accordingly avoiding travel during these times. For access over the hill during these times, you will need a booking. Please visit www.nzta.govt.nz/remutaka prior to the closures to apply for a booking.
properties.AlternativeRoute: Northbound traffic detour via SH1 to Ohau, then turn right onto SH57, continue along SH57 and then turn right onto SH3, continue along SH3 until you rejoin SH2 in Woodville. Reverse for southbound. Please note: this detour route will add approximately three and a half hours to your journey time.
properties.Name: Road Closure: SH 2 SH2 Kaitoke to Featherston (Remutaka Hill)

properties.EventComments: Due to flooding, the road is closed between Pirongia and Otorohanga. Delay your journey and avoid the area.

properties.Name: News: South Island Regional and District Council Websites

properties.Content:
FINAL UPDATE THU 17 OCT 2019

Kuaotunu River bridge reopens

Our contractors have done a fantastic job to get the bridge opened ahead of schedule, and more than a week before Labour weekend, despite the heavy rain and strong winds that battered the area earlier this week. Traffic management remains in place, including a 30km/h speed restriction.

Please note that, weather dependent, the bridge will need to close again for the day on Monday (21 Oct) to carry out resurfacing works.

---------------

 

UPDATE TUE 08 OCT 2019

Repairing Kuaotunu bridge to reconnect SH25 

Work to repair the Kuaotunu Bridge on SH25 Coromandel after last months storm is progressing well, with the bridge expected to reopen within the next couple of weeks.

The repair team has finished driving the piles on the northern side of the bridge and has switched to the southern side. Once all the piles have been driven they will need to be cut to size and the bridge abutments filled with concrete before work to reinstate the bridge deck can begin.

We understand that these works are frustrating for local residents and those who travel to the area often, however, our contractors are working as hard as they can to repair the damage as quickly and efficiently as possible, says Transport Agency Waikato Systems Manager Karen Boyt.  

The Transport Agency has joined together with Thames Coromandel District Council to provide a free shuttle bus service from Kuaotunu to Whitianga every day while the bridge is closed.

The Go Kiwi shuttle departs from outside the Kuaotunu fire station, at 7:30am and 8:30am and then returns from Whitianga at 4:30pm and 5:30pm. From Wednesday 9 October there will also be a lunchtime bus leaving Whitianga at 11.30 and Kuaotunu at 12pm. 

Anyone travelling in the area should check our Journey Planner, www.journeys.nzta.govt.nz or call 0800 44 44 49 before leaving for the most up to date information. 

[image src="/assets/8e66b60fd1/NZTA-3.jpg" id="1023" width="657" height="507" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="NZTA 3"]

[image src="/assets/5b38db22be/nzta-2.jpg" id="1022" width="657" height="586" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="nzta 2"]

 

 ---------------

Following an assessment after recent heavy rain, the SH25 Kuaotunu River bridge has been closed, for around five weeks, to repair weather damage.

We understand the frustration this may cause for those who live in or travel to the area often, however our contractors are working as hard as they can to repair the damage as quickly and efficiently as possible.

During this time detours will be clearly signposted via either SH25A and SH25 or SH25 Thames Coast Road.

 [image src="/assets/dd1a4446a4/Kuaotunu-IMG_STOP.jpg" id="1019" width="251" height="303" class="ss-htmleditorfield-file image right" title="Kuaotunu IMG STOP"]
  • Residents south of Blackjack Road will need to access Kuaotunu from Whitianga.
  • Residents west of the bridge will only have vehicle access from the Coromandel side.
  • Pedestrians will be able to cross the river via a separate, existing walk bridge. 

We hope to have the bridge open again by Labour Weekend, however, this is weather dependant. We will keep the community updated, and thank you for your patience during this time.

 

UPDATE TUE 24 SEP 2019

Repair works to SH25 Kuaotonu River Bridge began on Sunday 22 Sep, following an early morning karakia by local Iwi. Our contractors have started to remove the wooden deck after stripping back the seal layers. The seal and deck have been removed by hand, and efforts made to protect the environment by installing a platform below the deck.

[image src="/assets/b241894b48/Kuaotunu-IMG_6039.jpg" id="1018" width="733" height="550" class="leftAlone ss-htmleditorfield-file image" title="Kuaotunu IMG 6039"]
properties.Name: Road Work: Kuaotunu River Bridge Repairs
